properties.media:imagetext:
A note of interest:
In-flight entertainment 1s not new to
Pan American. Movies were snown
Pan Am Clippers® as long ago as 1945.
But never have the problems of project-
ing a movie within an aircraft been
solved so successfully as they have been
by
Theatre-in-the-Air.
Unlike single-screen
movie systems,
Theatre-in-the-Air doesn't make you
look over any shoulders, or strain your
eyes because your seat is up too close or
back too far. And, generally you don't
have to pull any curtains to keep the
light from hitting the picture.
These are some of the reasons why we
believe you'll agree
Theatre-in-the-Air
is the
most
personal and completely
enjoyable entertainment system aloft.
our Pan Am Theatre-in-
the-Air was specially designed and engineered to
offer you a variety in programmed entertainment.
Movies, both first runs and film classics, will be
featured, as well as special television productions.
On some flights you will also see travel films on
areas of the world you are visiting or may want to
visit.
There is something for everyone aboard—from
a children's hour for the youngsters to travel tips
for women and information on doing business
abroad for men. You'll find a wide choice of
music—two stereo channels—one featuring the
classics and the other playing soft music to fly by;
programs of musical hits, top tunes for the teens
and another featuring popular singers and bands,
as well as all-time musical favorites.
We hope you'll enjoy viewing and listening as
you fly Pan Am-World's Most Experienced Airline.
Sony Corporation of America manufactures the
Pan Am Theatre video system, the most advanced
in engineering design and reliability.
The Theatre-in-the-Air audio system, providing
clear and faithful sound reproduction, is supplied
by the United Data Control Company.
Audio material is produced exclusively for Pan
Am by National Musitime Corporation.
PRINTED IN VIDA. 8/00 A G
